definitions: person who designs and arranges dance movements and sequences for performances
professional who directs and coordinates movement patterns in theatrical productions
examples: The choreographer spent months creating routines for the Broadway show
She worked as a choreographer for major ballet companies worldwide
The film's choreographer coordinated all the action sequences perfectly
They hired a renowned choreographer to stage the wedding dance

definitions: art of designing and arranging dance movements and patterns in space and time
sequence of movements and steps arranged for a performance or production
examples: The choreography perfectly matched the emotional intensity of the music
She studied choreography at the prestigious dance academy
The fight scene's choreography made it look realistic yet safe
Their wedding choreography went viral on social media platforms

definitions: member of a choir who sings in organized vocal performances
young singer in a church or cathedral choir, often receiving musical training
examples: The choristers practiced twice weekly for the upcoming concert
She began her musical career as a chorister at age eight
The cathedral choristers wore traditional red and white robes
Young choristers receive both academic and musical education here

definitions: people or things that have been specifically selected for a particular purpose
those believed to be specially selected by divine will for salvation or purpose
examples: Only the chosen few were invited to the exclusive event
The chosen candidates underwent intensive training for six months
Many religions speak of the chosen who will inherit eternal life
The ancient texts referred to them as the chosen people

definitions: informal term for food or a meal, especially in military contexts
Chinese dog breed with thick fur and distinctive blue-black tongue
examples: The soldiers lined up for chow at the mess hall
Let's grab some chow before the movie starts tonight
Their chow chow won best in breed at the dog show
The ancient chow breed originated in northern China centuries ago

definitions: thick creamy soup typically containing seafood, vegetables, and milk or cream base
examples: The restaurant's clam chowder is famous throughout New England
She made corn chowder using her grandmother's traditional recipe

definitions: Jesus of Nazareth, regarded by Christians as the son of God and savior
expression of surprise, frustration, or emphasis in informal speech
examples: Christians believe Christ died for humanity's sins and rose again
The painting depicts Christ healing the sick and suffering
Christ, that was a close call with the speeding car
For Christ's sake, please be more careful next time

definitions: Christian religious ceremony where a baby or person is baptized and formally named
formal occasion or ceremony marking the first use or naming of something
examples: The baby's christening will take place at the family church
They invited close family and friends to witness the christening
The ship's christening involved breaking a champagne bottle on its hull
The building's christening ceremony attracted hundreds of attendees

definitions: shiny metallic coating of chromium applied to metal surfaces for decoration and protection
Google's web browser software used for accessing the internet
examples: The motorcycle's chrome exhaust pipes gleamed in the sunlight
They restored the vintage car's chrome bumpers to original condition
Chrome has become one of the most popular browsers worldwide
Update your Chrome browser to access the latest security features

definitions: thread-like structure of DNA and proteins found in cell nuclei carrying genetic information
examples: Humans typically have 46 chromosomes arranged in 23 pairs
The scientist studied chromosome abnormalities that cause genetic disorders

definitions: factual written account of historical events presented in chronological order
detailed narrative record or report of events over time
examples: The monastery's chronicle documented five centuries of local history
Medieval chronicles provide valuable insights into daily life then
The journalist's chronicle of the war won several prestigious awards
Her chronicle of family history spans three generations

definitions: person who writes chronicles or detailed records of historical events and times
examples: The medieval chronicler recorded both mundane and momentous events
She became the unofficial chronicler of their community's transformation

definitions: arrangement of events or dates in the order of their occurrence over time
document or list showing events arranged in temporal order
examples: The detective established a chronology of the suspect's movements
Understanding the chronology helps clarify cause and effect relationships
The book includes a detailed chronology of major historical events
She created a chronology spanning from 1900 to present day

definitions: flowering plant with bright colored blooms popular in gardens and floral arrangements worldwide
examples: The garden's chrysanthemums bloom brilliantly each autumn season
She arranged yellow chrysanthemums in the ceramic vase

definitions: cut of beef from the shoulder area typically used for roasting or stewing
mechanical device that holds a workpiece or tool in a lathe or drill
informal act of throwing something carelessly or with force
examples: The butcher recommended chuck roast for the slow cooker recipe
Ground chuck makes flavorful burgers with the right fat content
Tighten the drill chuck securely before starting the machine
The lathe chuck grips the workpiece during turning operations
Just chuck those old magazines in the recycling bin
He decided to chuck his corporate job and travel

definitions: informal term for a close friend or companion, especially among peers
chopped fish or other bait thrown into water to attract fish for catching
examples: He went fishing with his old college chum last weekend
The two chums had been inseparable since kindergarten days
The captain spread chum to attract sharks for the tourists
They used frozen chum to lure tuna closer to the boat

definitions: thick solid piece or lump of something broken or cut from a larger whole
discrete segment or portion of data in computing or information processing
examples: She added chunks of chocolate to the cookie dough mixture
Large chunks of ice floated down the river
The program processes data in manageable chunks for efficiency
Break the project into smaller chunks to avoid feeling overwhelmed

definitions: building used for Christian religious activities, worship services, and ceremonies
organized Christian religious institution with its doctrines, clergy, and administrative structure
body of Christian believers who regularly worship together as a community
examples: The old stone church has stood in the village for centuries
They were married in the church where her parents wed
The Catholic Church has influenced Western civilization for two millennia
Several churches united to form a new denomination
The whole church gathered to support the grieving family
Our church organizes community service projects every month

definitions: male member of the clergy or man devoted to church work and religious affairs
examples: The elderly churchman had served his parish for forty years
Several prominent churchmen attended the ecumenical conference

definitions: enclosed area surrounding a church typically used as a burial ground or cemetery
examples: Ancient gravestones filled the peaceful churchyard behind the chapel
Children played quietly in the churchyard after Sunday service

definitions: container or machine used for agitating cream to make butter
rate at which customers stop doing business with a company over time
examples: The antique butter churn was displayed in the farmhouse museum
She operated the churn until the cream transformed into butter
The company's customer churn rate increased after the price hike
Reducing churn is crucial for subscription-based business models

definitions: inclined channel or slide for conveying things to a lower level by gravity
informal shortened form of parachute used in aviation and sports
examples: Laundry goes down the chute from upper floors to the basement
The rescue chute deployed automatically when the plane door opened
His main chute failed but the reserve chute opened perfectly
Skydivers check their chutes thoroughly before each jump

definitions: thick sauce or relish made from fruits, spices, and vinegar, originating from Indian cuisine
examples: The mango chutney complemented the spicy curry perfectly
She made green chutney using fresh coriander and mint leaves

definitions: Italian greeting used informally to say both hello and goodbye in casual conversation
examples: She waved and called out ciao as she left the caf√©
Ciao bella became his signature greeting at the restaurant

definitions: large insect that produces loud rhythmic sounds, especially during summer mating season
examples: The cicadas' chorus filled the summer evening with droning sounds
Periodical cicadas emerge in massive numbers every seventeen years

definitions: beverage made from pressed apples, either fresh, fermented as hard cider, or heated with spices
examples: Hot apple cider warmed us after the autumn hayride
The orchard produces both sweet cider and hard cider varieties

definitions: tightly rolled bundle of dried and fermented tobacco leaves made for smoking
examples: He celebrated the birth with an expensive Cuban cigar
The humidor keeps cigars at optimal temperature and humidity

definitions: thin cylinder of finely cut tobacco rolled in paper for smoking
examples: She quit cigarettes after twenty years of smoking
Cigarette advertising has been banned in many countries worldwide

definitions: partly burnt piece of coal or wood that has stopped burning but still retains heat
examples: Hot cinders from the fireplace scattered onto the hearth
The volcano ejected cinders high into the night sky

definitions: building where films are shown to paying audiences on large screens
art and industry of making motion pictures as a form of entertainment or expression
examples: The new cinema downtown has twelve screens and reclining seats
We went to the cinema to see the latest blockbuster
French cinema greatly influenced filmmaking throughout the twentieth century
She studied cinema at the prestigious film school

definitions: professional responsible for the photography and visual look of a film or video production
examples: The cinematographer won an Oscar for the film's stunning visuals
She worked as cinematographer on several independent films

definitions: art and technique of motion picture photography including camera work, lighting, and visual composition
examples: The film's cinematography captured the desert's stark beauty perfectly
Students studied cinematography techniques from classic Hollywood films

definitions: brown aromatic spice obtained from tree bark, used in cooking and baking for flavor
examples: She sprinkled cinnamon on her morning oatmeal
The cinnamon rolls filled the bakery with sweet aroma

definitions: method of secret writing using substitution or transposition of letters according to a key
mathematical symbol (0) denoting absence of quantity or null value
person or thing of no importance or influence in a particular context
examples: The spy transmitted messages using a complex cipher system
Cryptographers worked to break the enemy's cipher
In some contexts, cipher represents the concept of nothingness
The ancient mathematicians developed the cipher for calculations
He felt like a cipher in the large corporate hierarchy
The king had become a mere cipher with no real power

definitions: round plane figure whose boundary consists of points equidistant from a fixed center
group of people with shared interests, activities, or social connections
recurring sequence of events or phenomena that returns to its starting point
examples: Draw a perfect circle with a compass for the geometry problem
The children sat in a circle for story time
She moved in elite literary circles in New York
Their circle of friends gathered every Friday evening
The seasons follow their endless circle year after year
History seems to move in circles, repeating similar patterns

definitions: complete path through which electric current flows from source back to source
regular journey around a particular area or between particular places for specific purposes
series of sporting events or competitions held at different venues
examples: The electrician tested the circuit before connecting the appliances
A broken circuit caused the power outage
The judge travels the judicial circuit twice each month
Sales representatives cover their circuit of retail stores weekly
She competed on the professional tennis circuit for ten years
The comedy circuit took him to clubs across the country

definitions: system of electric circuits and components that form the working parts of electronic devices
examples: The smartphone's circuitry fits on a board smaller than a credit card
Engineers redesigned the circuitry for better energy efficiency

definitions: having the form of a circle or ring in shape or movement
printed advertisement or notice distributed to a large number of people
examples: The castle had a circular tower at each corner
They arranged the chairs in a circular pattern
The store's weekly circular advertises this week's special deals
She received a circular about the upcoming community meeting

definitions: movement of blood through the body's vessels pumped by the heart
number of copies of a publication distributed or sold to readers
continuous movement of something through a system or area
examples: Poor circulation causes her hands and feet to feel cold
Exercise improves blood circulation throughout the body
The newspaper's circulation dropped by twenty percent last year
Digital subscriptions now exceed print circulation
Air circulation in the room improved after installing ceiling fans
The circulation of rumors damaged the company's reputation

definitions: surgical removal of the foreskin from the penis for medical or cultural reasons
religious ceremony involving circumcision as a rite of passage or covenant
examples: The doctor performed the circumcision in a sterile medical environment
Adult circumcision requires a longer recovery period
The circumcision ceremony marked the boy's entry into the religious community
Jewish circumcision traditionally occurs on the eighth day after birth

definitions: distance around the edge of a circle or any curved geometric figure
examples: Calculate the circumference using the formula with pi and diameter
The tree's circumference measured over fifteen feet

definitions: act of traveling all the way around something, especially sailing around the world
examples: Magellan's expedition completed the first circumnavigation of Earth
Their yacht circumnavigation took three years to complete

definitions: fact or condition connected with or relevant to an event or action
external conditions or factors affecting a situation beyond one's control
examples: Under normal circumstances, the procedure takes about an hour
The circumstances surrounding her disappearance remain mysterious
Financial circumstances forced them to sell their family home
Don't let circumstances dictate your happiness

definitions: act of finding a way around an obstacle, rule, or problem through clever or sometimes deceptive means
examples: The circumvention of safety protocols led to serious consequences
Lawyers found legal circumvention of the trade restrictions

definitions: tank for storing water, especially one supplying taps or below ground for rainwater collection
examples: The old house still uses a cistern for rainwater collection
They repaired the cracked cistern in the bathroom

definitions: fortress typically on high ground protecting or dominating a city
examples: The ancient citadel overlooked the entire valley below
Rebels took refuge in the mountain citadel

definitions: quotation from or reference to a book, paper, or author in scholarly work
official summons to appear in court or notice of traffic violation
official commendation or award for notable achievement or service
examples: Include proper citations for all sources in your research paper
The article lacked citations to support its claims
She received a citation for speeding in a school zone
The parking citation required payment within thirty days
The officer received a citation for bravery during the rescue
His citation noted exceptional service to the community

definitions: legally recognized subject or national of a state or commonwealth with associated rights and duties
inhabitant of a particular town or city participating in its civic life
examples: Citizens have the right to vote in national elections
She became a naturalized citizen after five years
Local citizens protested the proposed highway expansion
Good citizens contribute to their community's wellbeing

definitions: citizens of a place collectively considered as a group or political body
examples: The citizenry demanded transparency from their elected officials
An educated citizenry is essential for democracy to function

definitions: position or status of being a citizen with associated rights, duties, and privileges
qualities expected of a good citizen including participation and responsibility in society
examples: Dual citizenship allows her to hold passports from both countries
The citizenship test covers American history and government
Schools teach citizenship through community service programs
Good citizenship involves more than just obeying laws
